page.title: 09LUCKLEY FARM.
page.content: Luckley Farm has 365 acres. The farm used to be a dairy farm until 1968.The farm is now mainly arable and rough grazing.The main crops are wheat,barley and oats otherwise the fields are used for grazing their sheep, cattle and their horses (34 sheep,1 ram, 40 beef cattle, 6 horses.)A few of the horses are used for racing.The largest field is 32 acres, the smallest 4 acres.The farm is managed by one family and their relations.The land and building are owned by the Duke of Beaufort. This year's harvest has been poor because of heavy rainfall.The most recent project has been to empty and clean their reservoir. This reservoir was once the water supply to Badminton House.Luckley Farmland now produces more crops per acre; one acre is always kept for the family garden.
